name: Phosphoric Acid
desc: Phosphoric Acid is an inorganic chemical compound, an oxygenic acid containing three hydroxyl groups. As a food additive, it is designated by the symbol E338.
techs: Phosphoric Acid is a colorless solid that usually occurs as an 85% aqueous solution, which is a colorless, odorless, and non-volatile syrupy liquid.
shelf: The shelf life of Phosphoric Acid is 5 years.
packaging: Foodcom supplies its Business Partners with Phosphoric Acid in 25kg and in Big Bags
applications: Phosphoric Acid is an ingredient in fertilizers, detergents, and many household cleaning products. It is also used as a food additive to impart acidic properties to soft drinks and other prepared foods, and in water treatment products. Phosphoric Acid is an excellent rust remover. Applied to rust, it interacts with metal oxides and hydroxides, dissolving them and cleaning the metal surface.
